comments.body:
FYI: These comments should refer to json name rather than the go struct name. So this should be "zones is the list..." instead of "Zones is the list..." but I see we are not following that rule in federation types.go.
So we can fix Zones and Regions when we fix all others in these files.
These comments are automatically converted to user-facing documentation. Please don't reference Go types and field names. Use plain English and/or reference json field names.
Would you mind giving some good examples as I did looked the existing code and was confused of what you are up to.

To clarify, these comments are automatically converted to user facing documentation using swagger. Users of that documentation dont see the Go struct names but only the json. Hence, we refer to json field names in these comments rather than referring to Go struct name.

Hence instead of saying "Status" in comments, we say "status". And similarly "lastProbeTime". Hope this helps.
